title: Danylo Kondrakov
text:
Danylo Kondrakov (; born 19 January 1998) is a <a href="professional">professional</a> <a href="Ukraine">Ukrainian</a> <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> <a href="Striker%20%28association%20football%29">striker</a> who plays for <a href="FC%20Rukh%20Lviv">Rukh Lviv</a>.
Career.
Kondrakov is a product of <a href="FC%20Zorya%20Luhansk">FC Zorya Luhansk</a> and FC Azovstal Mariupol youth sportive school systems. At the Zorya sports school among his first coaches were Anatoliy Baranov, Oleksandr Zadorozhnyi, Yuriy Dudnyk. Due to the 2014 <a href="Russian%20aggression%20against%20Ukraine">Russian aggression against Ukraine</a>, he moved to <a href="Zaporizhia">Zaporizhia</a> where lives his grandfather and a basketball coach of local women team. In 2015 Kondrakov trained with DYuSSh Metalurh and coached by Volodymyr Shapovalov. Later he played for Metalurh U-19 Zaporizhia and Spartak-KPU in the Student League. In 2016 Kondrakov joined the reformed Metalurh Zaporizhia that restarted in amateurs and led by <a href="Illya%20Blyznyuk">Illya Blyznyuk</a>. As a footballer of Metalurh he made his debut in professional football on 13 September 2016 at away game of Round 9 against <a href="FC%20Real%20Pharma%20Odesa">FC Real Pharma Odesa</a> (<a href="Ukrainian%20Second%20League">Second League</a>).
At winter break during the 2016–17 season <a href="Oleh%20Lutkov">Oleh Lutkov</a> invited Kondrakov to Skala where he played for the Skala under-19 team.
He made his debut for FC Zirka as a substituted player in the second half-time in the match against <a href="FC%20Shakhtar%20Donetsk">FC Shakhtar Donetsk</a> on 23 September 2017 in the <a href="Ukrainian%20Premier%20League">Ukrainian Premier League</a>.
On 1 April 2019 Kondrakov signed with <a href="FC%20Rukh%20Vynnyky">FC Rukh Vynnyky</a>.
